discourse_list.title: Alternative proposal for the Ethereum 2.0 serialization spec

content.content: Péter Szilágyi has proposed Simple Offset Serialization (SOS), an alternative to the Simple Serialize (SSZ) proposed in the Ethereum 2.0 spec. There is a detailed Twitter discussion between @karalabe, @ricmoo, and @vbuterin about this proposal.   twitter.com          Péter Szilágyi (peter_szilagyi)     I have an alternative proposal for the #Ethereum 2.0 serialization spec. Has only 4 encoding rules (vs. 6 in SSZ), results in the exact same number of bytes, achieves O(log N) retrieval complexity (vs. O(N) in SSZ). Am I missing something @VitalikButerin?  https://t.co/1IaLCgXIey  6:51 PM - 13 Feb 2019     44          4
content.GPT-summary: Péter Szilágyi has proposed an alternative to the Simple Serialize (SSZ) proposed in the Ethereum 2.0 spec. He explains his proposal, Simple Offset Serialization (SOS), and asks for feedback from Vitalik Buterin. There is also a Twitter discussion between other individuals about the proposal, with some providing constructive criticism and asking questions.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal

content.content: This is a better thread to see for this subject: Discussion of EIP-1805
